results.title: Effects of third-generation beta-blockers, atenolol or amlodipine on blood pressure variability and target organ damage in spontaneously hypertensive rats.

results.title: Nebivolol is more effective than atenolol for blood pressure variability attenuation and target organ damage prevention in L-NAME hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@Nebivolol@@@ is more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for blood pressure variability attenuation and @<m>DISEASE_Organizing_Pneumonia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092124 @@@target organ damage@@@ prevention in @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Inhibition of inflammation contributes to organ protection of atenolol in sinoaortic-denervated rats.
results.text_hl: The present study was designed to test the hypothesis that inhibition of @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ contributes to the protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on the @<m>DISEASE_Organizing_Pneumonia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092124 @@@organ damage@@@ induced by sinoaortic denervation (SAD) in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang C, Xie HH, Lu ZA, Zhu MJ, Su DF. Inhibition of inflammation contributes to organ protection of atenolol in sinoaortic-denervated rats. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2004 May;43(5):663-8. PMID: 15071353

results.title: Comparison of the effects of doxazosin and atenolol on target organ damage in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension in the CARDHIAC study: a 9-month, prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded-evaluation trial.
